Function Documentation

struct metal_scatter_list* metal_shm_attach ( struct metal_generic_shmem *  shmem,
struct metal_device *  dev,
unsigned int  direction 
)

Attach a shared memory to a device.

This operation will attach the shared memory to a device. The device driver can notify the device to prepare access to this shared memory.

Parameters
[in]shmemShared memory to assign to the device
[in]devDevice the shared memory is attached to
[in]directionshared memory direction
Returns
attached shmem scatter list for success, NULL for failure.

References metal_device::bus, metal_shm_ref::dev, metal_log, METAL_LOG_ERROR, metal_generic_shmem::name, metal_device::name, metal_shm_ref::sg, and metal_generic_shmem::sg.

void metal_shm_detach ( struct metal_generic_shmem *  shmem,
struct metal_device *  dev 
)

Detach a shared memory from a device.

This operation will detach the shared memory from a device. The device driver can notify the device not to use this shared memory any more.

Parameters
[in]shmemShared memory to assign to the device
[in]devDevice the shared memory is detached to.

References metal_device::bus, metal_shm_ref::dev, metal_generic_shmem::lock, metal_container_of, and metal_generic_shmem::refs.

int metal_shm_sync_for_cpu ( struct metal_generic_shmem *  shmem,
unsigned int  direction 
)

sync shared memory for cpu access

This operation will make sure the host can write/read data to/from the shared memory. The device is not expected to access the shared memory after this operation until metal_shm_sync_for_device() is called.

Parameters
[in]shmemShared memory to attach to a device
[in]directionindicate if sync is to write to the device or read from it.
Returns
0 for success, negative value for failure.

References metal_generic_shmem::ops.

int metal_shm_sync_for_device ( struct metal_generic_shmem *  shmem,
struct metal_device *  dev,
unsigned int  direction 
)

sync shared memory for device access

This operation will make sure the device can write/read data to/from the shared memory. The host is not expected to access the shared memory until metal_shm_sync_for_cpu() is called.

Parameters
[in]shmemShared memory to attach to a device
[in]devdevice the shared memory will attach to
[in]directionindicate if it is to write to the device or read from the device.
Returns
0 for success, negative value for failure.

int metal_shmem_open ( const char *  name,
size_t  size,
unsigned int  flags,
struct metal_generic_shmem **  result 
)

Open a libmetal shared memory segment.

Open a shared memory segment. If the shared memory is not opened, it will open the shared memory from the speicified provider.

Parameters
[in]nameName of segment to open. The name format is expected to be "/shmem_provider/shmem"
[in]sizeSize of segment.
[in]flagsShmem flags to indicate if it wants cacheable or not.
[out]resultshared memory handle, if successful.
Returns
0 on success, or -errno on failure.

References metal_shm_provider::alloc, metal_generic_shmem::flags, metal_generic_shmem::lock, metal_log, METAL_LOG_ERROR, metal_shmem_get_provider(), metal_shmem_register_generic(), metal_generic_shmem::name, metal_generic_shmem::provider, and metal_generic_shmem::refs.

int metal_shmem_register_generic ( struct metal_generic_shmem *  shmem)

Statically register a generic shared memory region.

Shared memory regions may be statically registered at application initialization, or may be dynamically opened. This interface is used for static registration of regions. Subsequent calls to metal_shmem_open() look up in this list of pre-registered regions.

Parameters
[in]shmemGeneric shmem structure.
Returns
0 on success, or -errno on failure.

References _metal, metal_state::common, metal_common_state::generic_shmem_list, metal_generic_shmem::name, and metal_generic_shmem::node.
